snippet.title: 21 Things On In Victoria
snippet.content: 21 things you can choose to do or not. Freedom of choice, girls and boice. 1. BOOM! SHAKE SHAKE THE ROOM Will Smith would be soooo into The So Freshtival. It's exactly what you hope it would be: DJs spin selected hits from the So Fresh compilation era. Think Jazzy Jeff and The Fresh Prince (a fave of the DJs/crowd/Will), S Club 7, Bon Jovi, Bomfunk MCs, Eiffel 65, Sisqo, Aqua, The Pussycat Dolls and more cheese. The DJ talent includes Dr Phil Smith, Flex Mami, Slick Slazenger, Sharon Von Mueller, Leni & Tobi and Rottweild. The Gasometer, 484 Smith St, Collingwood. Tomorrow, 3pm. $10/$15. thegasometerhotel.com.au 2. WHAT A WAY TO WAGNER Did you know Marius Vlad (pictured, intense) is considered one of only 20 voices worldwide capable of singing the demanding title roles in Wagner's operas? Well, aren't you a smart one. Vlad the Exhaler (my new nickname for him) stars in Lohengrin as the mysterious Knight of the Grail in a sizzling production by Melbourne Opera. He'll be joined by 160 singers and musicians in what can only be described as an absolute logistical nightmare for the person herding those cats. Wagner's romantic drama is adapted from a story by an unknown German, closely related to other stories in the Knight of the Swan tradition (the 2017 custom of Hawks beating Swans). Enjoy this macabre fairytale. Regent theatre, 191 collins st, city. Mon, 7pm, thu, 7pm, sat, 7pm. $49.76 to $86.86. ticketmaster.com.au 3. PLUG IN YA PLECTRUMS The Mercy Kills are ready to rock The Melbourne Guitar Show. They'll share the bill with Steve Hackett, Lloyd Spiegel, Fiona Boyes and Diesel. Plus panels, demos and new technology. Caulfield Racecourse, station st. Sat, 10am-6pm, Sun, 10am-5pm. $10 to $50. australianmusician.com.au 4. DREAM TEAM When I was in prep, we would listen to the teacher read The Rainbow Serpent and hear Aboriginal Dreamtime stories. Now preschoolers can experience games (such as marngrook), music and yarns that have entranced children for thousands of years. The focus is on indigenous culture at the Little Kids' Day In: First Peoples. Try ochre painting, create bush bouquets and nut collages. Scienceworks, 2 Booker st, Spotswood. Mon, 10am-2pm. $14. museumvictoria.com.au/scienceworks 5. BLOOD LUST Daniel Day-Lewis is terrifying in There Will Be Blood. The MSO will ensure his shark-eyed malevolence is accentuated when it plays Jonny Greenwood's (Radiohead) live to a screening of the Paul Thomas Anderson film. Chilling quote: "If you have a milkshake. And I have a milkshake. And if I have a straw ... My straw reaches across the room, and starts to drink your milkshake. I drink your milkshake! I drink it up!" Hamer Hall, the Arts Centre. Sat, 7pm. $45 to $99. mso.com.au HOT FIVE - SHOW-OFFS 6. MASTERING MUSIC, MASTERING LIFE Mental health is a hot button topic but there's not enough support for it in the entertainment industry. Super-producer Tony "Jack The Bear" Mantz is joined by Tom Larkin, Dallas Frasca, Mike Erlington, Lorenzo Sillitto (ex Temper Trap) and DJ John Course for a fruitful discourse. The Croxton, 607 High St, Thornbury. Sun, 3pm. $43.90. thecroxton.com.au 7. EAT DRINK WESTFIELD Cats WAG Emma Hawkins shows how to create the perfect cheese board (Westfield Geelong, today, 11am-noon), Sneaky Cheese Burger pop-up and Switch Lifestyle (Westfield Fountain Gate, today-tomorrow), cool DJ with a delicious doughnut wall (Westfield Doncaster, today-tomorrow, 10am-5pm) and more. Westfield locations. Sat-Sun, various times. Free. Westfield.com.au 8. CONCERT: THE CASEY BENNETTO PROJECT The effervescent Bennetto is joined by Tripod to play deep grooves with high and lowbrow lyrics. Get Casey to do Yoda-speak, you will. Hmyesss. Bella Union, level 1, 54 Victoria st, Carlton. Thu, 7pm. $17/$20. bellaunion.com.au 9. STAND UP COMEDY: JACK DRUCE Comedians are the new chefs. Young Druce (sounds like a Norwich Rising Star) is not yet cordon bleu, but he sure is cooking. Those dishy dimples are infectious. Club Voltaire, 14 Raglan St, North Melbourne. Sat, next three Saturdays, 8.30-9.30PM, $15. eventbrite.com.au 10. CONCERT: ORCHESTRATED Hear classical takes on classic tracks from Fatboy Slim, Bag Raiders, Shapeshifters and Massive Attack - all shapeshifted to blend with The MSO. Hamer Hall, the Arts Centre. Fri, 8pm. $95 to $116. artscentremelbourne.com.au 11. LEEMPEEYT WEEYN It means campfire. Be mesmerised by the fire, watch live performances and hear storytelling. The Square, Fed Square. Until Aug 20. Daily, 24 hrs. Free. Fedsquare.com 12. A MAD TEA PARTY Celebrate Alice in Yarnderland: a Crowdsourced Textile Installation. 340 Toorak rd, South Yarra. Next Sat, 4-6pm. free. stonnington.vic.gov.au 13. LIVE FROZEN EVENT Elsa will perform and involve kids with dance. Facepainting, too. 158 Acland st, St Kilda. Sat, noon-3pm. free. aclandcourt.com.au 14. VINTAGE TALKING TRAM TOUR Get an expert and edutaining lecture as you glide around the town and get the skinny. Bendigo Tramways. Sat, various times. $17.50. Bendigotourism.com.au 15. DIARY OF A WOMBAT Stage show of roly-poly carrot champion who just wants to train humans for good. Frankston Arts Centre, 27-37 Davey st. Tue, 11am & 6pm. $17.50/$20. Thefac.com.au WEEKEND MARKETS 16. ST KILDA ESPLANADE Vast array of arts and crafts stalls and Foodie Zone, Liza Clements photography and Street Crepes. Sun 10am-4pm. Upper Esplanade. 17. LOST AND FOUND Winter family day. See Lachlan from the Magic School of Confidence, The Real Jerk Food Truck, pin the tail on the donkey. Sat 10am-5pm. 511 lygon st, Brunswick East. 18. BUMBLE BEE BABY Bibs, teething rings, teaching products, cots, prams, change tables, car seats, and hand and feet sculptures. Sun, 9am-noon. 35 Gwendoline Drive, Berwick 19. KALLISTA COMMUNITY Make it, bake it, grow it. Christine's organic bread, Patchwork Apiary honey, 7Beans vego meals. Sat, 9am-1pm. 2 Church st 20. MORAL FAIRGROUND Ethical product sourcing from fairtrade suppliers who cover all your karmic consumerist needs. Sun, 10am-4pm. Preston city hall 21. ARTS CENTRE SUNDAY MARKET More than 80 stalls of artisans and delicious foodstuffs and curious onlookers. Every Sun 10am-4pm. St Kilda Rd, city. For more of this malarky, hit me up:
